alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 17 at 6:49PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 PM PDT, CHP reported water running across US 395 near the intersection of SR 190. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Olancha and Cartago. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
